verses.text_plain: Again the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,
verses.verse_html: 1Again the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

verses.text_plain: Son of man, speak to the children of thy people, and say unto them, When I bring the sword upon a land, if the people of the land take a man of their coasts, and set him for their watchman:
verses.verse_html:
2Son of man, speak to the children of thy people, and say unto them, When I bring the sword upon a land, if the people of the land take a man of their coasts, and set him for their watchman: ▼
▼ When…: Heb. A land when I bring a sword upon her

footnotes.body_text: ▼ When…: Heb. A land when I bring a sword upon her
footnotes.body_html: ▼ When…: Heb. A land when I bring a sword upon her

verses.text_plain: If when he seeth the sword come upon the land, he blow the trumpet, and warn the people;
verses.verse_html: 3If when he seeth the sword come upon the land, he blow the trumpet, and warn the people;

verses.text_plain: Then whosoever heareth the sound of the trumpet, and taketh not warning; if the sword come, and take him away, his blood shall be upon his own head.
verses.verse_html:
4Then whosoever heareth the sound of the trumpet, and taketh not warning; if the sword come, and take him away, his blood shall be upon his own head. ▼
▼ whosoever…: Heb. he that hearing heareth

tokens.text: shall be upon his own head

footnotes.body_text: ▼ whosoever…: Heb. he that hearing heareth
footnotes.body_html: ▼ whosoever…: Heb. he that hearing heareth

verses.text_plain: He heard the sound of the trumpet, and took not warning; his blood shall be upon him. But he that taketh warning shall deliver his soul.
verses.verse_html: 5He heard the sound of the trumpet, and took not warning; his blood shall be upon him. But he that taketh warning shall deliver his soul.

tokens.text: shall be upon him. But he that taketh warning

verses.text_plain: But if the watchman see the sword come, and blow not the trumpet, and the people be not warned; if the sword come, and take any person from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at the watchman’s hand.
verses.verse_html: 6But if the watchman see the sword come, and blow not the trumpet, and the people be not warned; if the sword come, and take any person from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at the watchman’s hand.

tokens.text: from among them, he is taken away

verses.text_plain: So thou, O son of man, I have set thee a watchman unto the house of Israel; therefore thou shalt hear the word at my mouth, and warn them from me.
verses.verse_html: 7So thou, O son of man, I have set thee a watchman unto the house of Israel; therefore thou shalt hear the word at my mouth, and warn them from me.

verses.text_plain: When I say unto the wicked, O wicked man, thou shalt surely die; if thou dost not speak to warn the wicked from his way, that wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at thine hand.
verses.verse_html: 8When I say unto the wicked, O wicked man, thou shalt surely die; if thou dost not speak to warn the wicked from his way, that wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at thine hand.

verses.text_plain: Nevertheless, if thou warn the wicked of his way to turn from it; if he do not turn from his way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.
verses.verse_html: 9Nevertheless, if thou warn the wicked of his way to turn from it; if he do not turn from his way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.

tokens.text: from it; if he do not turn

verses.text_plain: Therefore, O thou son of man, speak unto the house of Israel; Thus ye speak, saying, If our transgressions and our sins be upon us, and we pine away in them, how should we then live?
verses.verse_html: 10Therefore, O thou son of man, speak unto the house of Israel; Thus ye speak, saying, If our transgressions and our sins be upon us, and we pine away in them, how should we then live?

tokens.text: upon us, and we pine away
in them, how should we then live

verses.text_plain: Say unto them, As I live, saith the Lord God, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked; but that the wicked turn from his way and live: turn ye, turn ye from your evil ways; for why will ye die, O house of Israel?
verses.verse_html: 11Say unto them, As I live, saith the Lord God, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked; but that the wicked turn from his way and live: turn ye, turn ye from your evil ways; for why will ye die, O house of Israel?

verses.text_plain: Therefore, thou son of man, say unto the children of thy people, The righteousness of the righteous shall not deliver him in the day of his transgression: as for the wickedness of the wicked, he shall not fall thereby in the day that he turneth from his wickedness; neither shall the righteous be able to live for his righteousness in the day that he sinneth.
verses.verse_html: 12Therefore, thou son of man, say unto the children of thy people, The righteousness of the righteous shall not deliver him in the day of his transgression: as for the wickedness of the wicked, he shall not fall thereby in the day that he turneth from his wickedness; neither shall the righteous be able to live for his righteousness in the day that he sinneth.

verses.text_plain: When I shall say to the righteous, that he shall surely live; if he trust to his own righteousness, and commit iniquity, all his righteousnesses shall not be remembered; but for his iniquity that he hath committed, he shall die for it.
verses.verse_html: 13When I shall say to the righteous, that he shall surely live; if he trust to his own righteousness, and commit iniquity, all his righteousnesses shall not be remembered; but for his iniquity that he hath committed, he shall die for it.

verses.text_plain: Again, when I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; if he turn from his sin, and do that which is lawful and right;
verses.verse_html:
14Again, when I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; if he turn from his sin, and do that which is lawful and right; ▼
▼ that…: Heb. judgment and justice

footnotes.body_html: ▼ that…: Heb. judgment and justice

verses.text_plain: If the wicked restore the pledge, give again that he had robbed, walk in the statutes of life, without committing iniquity; he shall surely live, he shall not die.
verses.verse_html: 15If the wicked restore the pledge, give again that he had robbed, walk in the statutes of life, without committing iniquity; he shall surely live, he shall not die.

verses.text_plain: None of his sins that he hath committed shall be mentioned unto him: he hath done that which is lawful and right; he shall surely live.
verses.verse_html: 16None of his sins that he hath committed shall be mentioned unto him: he hath done that which is lawful and right; he shall surely live.

verses.text_plain: Yet the children of thy people say, The way of the Lord is not equal: but as for them, their way is not equal.
verses.verse_html: 17Yet the children of thy people say, The way of the Lord is not equal: but as for them, their way is not equal.

tokens.text: but as for them, their way

verses.text_plain: When the righteous turneth from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity, he shall even die thereby.
verses.verse_html: 18When the righteous turneth from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity, he shall even die thereby.

verses.text_plain: But if the wicked turn from his wickedness, and do that which is lawful and right, he shall live thereby.
verses.verse_html: 19But if the wicked turn from his wickedness, and do that which is lawful and right, he shall live thereby.

verses.text_plain: Yet ye say, The way of the Lord is not equal. O ye house of Israel, I will judge you every one after his ways.
verses.verse_html: 20Yet ye say, The way of the Lord is not equal. O ye house of Israel, I will judge you every one after his ways.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, that one that had escaped out of Jerusalem came unto me, saying, The city is smitten.
verses.verse_html: 21And it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, that one that had escaped out of Jerusalem came unto me, saying, The city is smitten.

tokens.text: And it came to pass in the twelfth

verses.text_plain: Now the hand of the Lord was upon me in the evening, afore he that was escaped came; and had opened my mouth, until he came to me in the morning; and my mouth was opened, and I was no more dumb.
verses.verse_html: 22Now the hand of the Lord was upon me in the evening, afore he that was escaped came; and had opened my mouth, until he came to me in the morning; and my mouth was opened, and I was no more dumb.

tokens.text: was upon me in the evening
and I was no more dumb

verses.text_plain: Then the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,
verses.verse_html: 23Then the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

verses.text_plain: Son of man, they that inhabit those wastes of the land of Israel speak, saying, Abraham was one, and he inherited the land: but we are many; the land is given us for inheritance.
verses.verse_html: 24Son of man, they that inhabit those wastes of the land of Israel speak, saying, Abraham was one, and he inherited the land: but we are many; the land is given us for inheritance.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Ye eat with the blood, and lift up your eyes toward your idols, and shed blood: and shall ye possess the land?
verses.verse_html: 25Wherefore say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Ye eat with the blood, and lift up your eyes toward your idols, and shed blood: and shall ye possess the land?

verses.text_plain: Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour’s wife: and shall ye possess the land?
verses.verse_html: 26Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour’s wife: and shall ye possess the land?

verses.text_plain: Say thou thus unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; As I live, surely they that are in the wastes shall fall by the sword, and him that is in the open field will I give to the beasts to be devoured, and they that be in the forts and in the caves shall die of the pestilence.
verses.verse_html:
27Say thou thus unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; As I live, surely they that are in the wastes shall fall by the sword, and him that is in the open field will I give to the beasts to be devoured, and they that be in the forts and in the caves shall die of the pestilence. ▼
▼ to be…: Heb. to devour him

tokens.text: thou thus unto them, Thus saith

footnotes.body_text: ▼ to be…: Heb. to devour him
footnotes.body_html: ▼ to be…: Heb. to devour him

verses.text_plain: For I will lay the land most desolate, and the pomp of her strength shall cease; and the mountains of Israel shall be desolate, that none shall pass through.
verses.verse_html:
28For I will lay the land most desolate, and the pomp of her strength shall cease; and the mountains of Israel shall be desolate, that none shall pass through. ▼
▼ most…: Heb. desolation and desolation

footnotes.body_html: ▼ most…: Heb. desolation and desolation

verses.text_plain: Then shall they know that I am the Lord, when I have laid the land most desolate because of all their abominations which they have committed.
verses.verse_html: 29Then shall they know that I am the Lord, when I have laid the land most desolate because of all their abominations which they have committed.

verses.text_plain: Also, thou son of man, the children of thy people still are talking against thee by the walls and in the doors of the houses, and speak one to another, every one to his brother, saying, Come, I pray you, and hear what is the word that cometh forth from the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
30Also, thou son of man, the children of thy people still are talking against thee by the walls and in the doors of the houses, and speak one to another, every one to his brother, saying, Come, I pray you, and hear what is the word that cometh forth from the Lord. ▼
▼ against thee: or, of thee

footnotes.body_html: ▼ against thee: or, of thee

verses.text_plain: And they come unto thee as the people cometh, and they sit before thee as my people, and they hear thy words, but they will not do them: for with their mouth they shew much love, but their heart goeth after their covetousness.
verses.verse_html:
31And they come unto thee as the people cometh, and they sit before thee as my people, and they hear thy words, but they will not do them: for with their mouth they shew much love, but their heart goeth after their covetousness. ▼
▼ as the…: Heb. according to the coming of the people
 , ▼
▼ they sit…: or, my people sit before thee
 , ▼
▼ they shew…: Heb. they make loves, or, jests

footnotes.body_text: ▼ as the…: Heb. according to the coming of the people
footnotes.body_html: ▼ as the…: Heb. according to the coming of the people

footnotes.body_text: ▼ they sit…: or, my people sit before thee
footnotes.body_html: ▼ they sit…: or, my people sit before thee

footnotes.body_text: ▼ they shew…: Heb. they make loves, or, jests
footnotes.body_html: ▼ they shew…: Heb. they make loves, or, jests

verses.text_plain: And, lo, thou art unto them as a very lovely song of one that hath a pleasant voice, and can play well on an instrument: for they hear thy words, but they do them not.
verses.verse_html:
32And, lo, thou art unto them as a very lovely song of one that hath a pleasant voice, and can play well on an instrument: for they hear thy words, but they do them not. ▼
▼ a very…: Heb. a song of loves

tokens.text: unto them as a very lovely
of one that hath a pleasant

footnotes.body_text: ▼ a very…: Heb. a song of loves
footnotes.body_html: ▼ a very…: Heb. a song of loves

verses.text_plain: And when this cometh to pass, (lo, it will come,) then shall they know that a prophet hath been among them.
verses.verse_html: 33And when this cometh to pass, (lo, it will come,) then shall they know that a prophet hath been among them.

tokens.text: And when this cometh to pass
